title: Gunshot wound
summary: A gunshot wound (GSW) is physical trauma caused by a projectile from a firearm.[11][12] Damage may include bleeding, broken bones, organ damage, infection of the wound, loss of the ability to move part of the body and, in more severe cases, death.[2] Damage depends on the part of the body hit, the path the bullet follows through the body, and the type and speed of the bullet.[12] Long-term complications can include lead poisoning and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD).[1][2][13]
